result.execSummary:
The defendant Ude Onwuasoanya was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ude Onwuasoanya

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ude Onwuasoanya in court.  Attorney David Carl Bangert in court for Ude Onwuasoanya.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing hearing. 
Pursuant to negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered charge AMENDED to Disorderly Conduct, County Ordinance 63.01 to which defendant plead no contest. 
Court found defendant guilty of the amended charge and and ordered defendant to pay a forfeiture of $350.00 inclusive of all costs to be paid within 3 MONTHS. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Defendant Ude Onwuasoanya in court.  Attorney David Carl Bangert in court for Ude Onwuasoanya.  Attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Case scheduled for plea/sentencing hearing. Court is in trial with another matter and orders case rescheduled.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Ude Onwuasoanya appeared by video.  Attorney David Carl Bangert appeared by video for Ude Onwuasoanya.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defense is in receipt of discovery and offer and requests a plea and sentencing date.
Case adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Oral No Contact Order with TC.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 8/12/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 13.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 13.

Defendant Ude Onwuasoanya in court with Attorney David Carl Bangert.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 076443,
Payable Number: 1025120,
Receipt Number: 22RP032030,
Amount: $20.00
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Ude Onwuasoanya not in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/30/22 @ 2P
